title: Crypto-related investment fraud rose 53% in 2023: FBI
description:
According to the FBI, cryptocurrency-related investment fraud accounted for 86% of all investment losses within the United States in 2023.

The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) reported that cryptocurrency-related investment fraud constituted the largest portion of investment losses within the United States in 2023. 

In a recent report, the FBI stated that investment losses involving crypto increased from $2.57 billion in 2022, to around $3.94 billion in 2023, representing a 53% increase.

Meanwhile, the overall amount lost from all investments in 2023 totaled $4.57 billion. This means the $3.94 billion lost in crypto-related fraud made up approximately 86% of all investment fraud losses in the nation.

Read more

title: Bitcoin Options Boom: Traders Bet $20 Million on $200,000 $BTC Strike Price
description: A renewed surge in interest for Bitcoin options has been reflecting the bullish sentiment seen in the cryptocurrency space, with Deribit-listed Bitcoin call options with a strike price of $200,000 seeing a notional open interest of over $20 million. title: OpenAI Overhauls Governance Structure Post Sam Altman’s Reinstatement
description: In a pivotal move aimed at revamping its governance structure, OpenAI announced significant changes nearly five months after the ousting of CEO Sam Altman. The company unveiled a series of improvements to its governance, including the rejoining of Altman to its board of directors alongside three new appointments.
